title: Rolls-Royce worker's mashed potato on toast meal branded 'crazy vomit carb fest'
text:
A Rolls-Royce employee has divided opinion online after confessing to indulging himself in carb-laden mashed potato on toast meals laden with butter and cheese.

Chris Duro, from Derby, said on social media that his bizarre recipe is a 'culinary classic'.

However, the sensational dish appears not to be to everyone's tastes, with one branding it a 'crazy vomit carb fest too far', while other's claimed it symbolised the 'food of champions'.

Others were put off by the idea that the mashed potato was served without any gravy.

The dispute may represent the famed north-south divide, according to Derbyshire Live, which reported the post, claiming that Northerners generally prefer to lather any form of potato in gravy, while Southerners tend not to do this.

Rolls-Royce employee Chris Duro has divided opinion online after confessing to indulging himself in, pictured above, mashed potato on toast with butter and cheese as a meal

In his post about the meal on Facebook, Chris added a photo of the white bread piled high with mashed potato and lathered in butter, before being sprinkled with some cheese.

A snap shows him holding a medal after completing a run, so perhaps the snack was created with carb loading in mind.

Responding online one friend said: 'That's...what...how...err...nope. Just, no.'

And a second said: 'I'm sorry but mashed potato needs gravy.'

The man from Derby, pictured above and who appears to be an avid runner, said he felt 'ostracised' after receiving several negative responses on social media

However, some people that saw the post came out to defend Chris's choice of meal.

One typed: 'I see no problem with this! Carbs with a side of carbs...love toast, love mash...lots of fibre! Just needs to be covered in more cheese...food of champions Chris!'

After seeing the comments, Chris said he felt 'ostracised' and that he never realised this 'was such a monitory group'.
description: Rolls-Royce employee Chris Duro from Derby posted a picture of his 'culinary classic' mashed potato on toast on Facebook, but was hit with a wave of criticism over the carb-heavy meal.
